channel.title: new years on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in new years on Barefoot Rob

item.title: past week
item.description: 13:27 Monday 08 January 2018 JST Today is the last day of winter holiday for me. Lin and I have been back home for a week, during which I have mostly worked on Godot, read The Power of Now, watched movies with Lin, and worked a bit on MT3. This past Saturday, we went to see her family for Happy New Year, and I have been chatting with her niece in English on LINE since then.

item.title: New Years 2015
item.description: ##01:25 Saturday 03 January 2015 JST## It was my first time to go to a temple for New Years in Japan. It wasn’t as crowded as I expected, though there was a pretty long line of people queued up to pray(?). There was a bit of a mob near the bell that emanated some great reverberations each time a group went up to ring it. I was like, “I wanna ring it!

item.title: New Years lunch with Ma and Fred in Japan 3 Jan 2013
item.description: ##family lunch in Japan 03 Jan 2013 (written 01:28 Monday 24 November 2014 JST) Nice day!

item.title: ThisIsIt!
item.description: Friday 5:04pm CST 31 December 1999 This is the last day of the nineteens!!!!!! There's the whole debate about, "well, it's not really the millenium or even the century cause way back in the day they started counting with 1 not 0 blahdiddyblah." Yes, I say, but realistically, what is *cool* is seeing those 000 zeros roll up onto the calendar. I mean, driving in the car people don't say oh look!

item.title: New years
item.description: The moment 1999 arrived, I couldn't believe it. "Holy Shit it's 1999!" I kept yelling through the din. "Nineteen Ninety-Nine!!" "WENDE!! IT'S NINETEEN NINETY-NINE!!!" "I know!" "So kiss me!"
